intro: Viola grypoceras var. grypoceras, commonly known as the purple heart viola, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers with a distinctive purple throat, blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
